name: Introduction to Humanities
description: This course introduces students to the larger field of Humanities, which includes the study of philosophy, literature, and art history.

name: Art History I
description: This course provides a basic overview of the major trends and movements in art history, including the Renaissance, Baroque, and Neoclassical periods.

name: Art History II
description: This course provides a more in-depth look at the major trends and movements in art history, including the Romanticism, Impressionism, and Modernism periods.

name: Advanced Art History I
description: This course provides an overview of advanced topics in art history, including Postmodernism, Poststructuralism, and Critical Theory.

name: Advanced Art History II
description: This course provides an in-depth look at advanced topics in art history, including Contemporary Art, Globalization, and New Media.
